result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley C Hays was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with any victim/witness.
Attend Domestic Violence course.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion, as well as to the straight time or huber time.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bradley C Hays in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as his client still needs to complete more counseling. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Approved by Judge Maxwell 4/7/16

Defendant Bradley C Hays in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjounment for his client to complete some more treatment. Court grants.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Adjournment request filed by Attorney Buting

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any witness listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant Bradley C Hays in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
